column5: Hey guys,  I was wondering if anyone from forum was st LPB this year ice fishing...never been there in the winter and thinking to give it a try. I'm sure that will be no problem with the ice..he he ...this winter took good care of that. I am interested to know which area is easier to walk to and from where should i start...and which bait shops around LPB have minnows for sale.  Thank you! Cheers!  Gino
it's ok to pm me if your info is too specific..

Most people walk out from Akers/Bayside Ice Fishing in St. williams. They have minnows there I believe but if not R&R Outdoors in Long Point always has some. You can also walk out from the Old Cut in LP. From what I hear that is the better area this week.

Grangers and Bay Side has minnows at St. Williams. Was out today and lots of water on top. Only caught 2 dink Perch, talk to others and nada fish. An odd guy will be catching if you find that magic lucky spot. Watch the crack out there, you could go for a swim.
Hey Gino,  Here is a good website for the long point area for ice fishing.  There is a couple operators out of St. Williams and one out of Old cut.  Hope it helps.  http://www.longpoint.on.ca/forum/
thanks Icefisher, i will check that forum
